global.serviceName: Complete a Medical certificate of cause of death (MCCD)
global.pageTitle: Complete a Medical certificate of cause of death (MCCD) - NHSBSA
global.check-details: Check that all the details are correct before this is sent to the registrar.
global.check-details-check-your-answer: Check that all the details are correct before continuing.

start.title: Complete a Medical certificate of cause of death (MCCD)
start.paragraph-0: Use this digital MCCD to create or complete a Medical certificate of cause of death (MCCD). It is to be used for adults, children, and infants dying within the first 28 days of life.
start.paragraph-1: An MCCD is required to register all non-coronial deaths in England and Wales.
start.paragraph-2: This digital MCCD replaces the paper MCCD. It does not replace your current methods of communication or processes between the medical examiner office and attending practitioner. For example, when discussing a cause of death or an amendment to the MCCD you must continue to contact your colleagues by email or telephone.
start.paragraph-3: An MCCD can be completed by a doctor who attended the deceased person at any time.
start.paragraph-4: If an attending practitioner cannot be found and the senior coroner decides not to investigate the death, they will refer the case to a medical examiner to certify the death. The medical examiner MCCD will only be used in exceptional circumstances.
start.warning-text-1: An MCCD is not required in the case of a stillbirth
start.paragraph-5: Registration of stillbirths is a separate process from death certification. Refer to the guidance for registering a stillbirth.
start.heading-3: Who can use this digital MCCD
start.list-1: If you are an attending practitioner, you can use this digital MCCD to:
start.list-2: If you are a medical examiner, you can use this digital MCCD to:
start.list-3: If you are a medical examiner officer, you can use this digital MCCD to:
start.list3-item-2: download a completed MCCD to send to the registrar
start.paragraph-6: The local register office will use the completed MCCD to register the death of a deceased person. The family of a deceased person will not view the MCCD.
start.paragraph-7: You'll need a secure method of logging in such as your smartcard as supplied by the NHS Care Identity Service.
start.heading-5: Before you create or review an MCCD
start.paragraph-8: You'll need the personal details of the deceased person, and medical information relating to the cause of death.
start.warning-text-2: Once you have signed in, if you do not do anything for 15 minutes any information you have not saved will be deleted

cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.heading3: How we use the information we collect
cookies.what0: Cookies are files saved on your phone, tablet or computer when you visit a website.
cookies.what1: They store information about how you use the website, such as the pages you visit.
cookies.what2: Cookies are not viruses or computer programs. They are very small so do not take up much space.
cookies.use1: make our website work, for example by keeping it secure
cookies.use3: measure how you use our website, such as which links you click on (analytics cookies)
cookies.use4: help show you relevant health campaigns on social media
cookies.list: List of cookies that make our website work
cookies.tracking0: Some cookies, like those needed to measure how you use our website, are not needed for our website to work.
cookies.tracking1: These cookies can help up make our website better, but we'll only use them if you say it's OK.
cookies.find-out: To find out how we collect, store and use information about you or your visit, see the

cookie-details.title: Choose which cookies we use
cookie-details.let-us-know: Let us know which cookies we can use. We'll use a cookie to save your settings for the next 3 calendar months.  This setting applies across all our digital services, not just the one you are accessing now.
cookie-details.heading0: Cookies that measure website use (analytics cookies)
cookie-details.information: These cookies store information about how you use our website, such as the links you click on. We use them to help make our website better.
cookie-details.list: List of cookies that measure website use (analytics cookies)
cookie-details.legend: Do you want to allow cookies to measure your website use?
cookie-details.yes: Use cookies to measure my website use
cookie-details.no: Do not use cookies to measure my website use

cookie-confirmation.title: Your cookie settings have been saved
cookie-confirmation.save: We'll save your settings for a year.
cookie-confirmation.list0: We'll ask you if you're still OK with us using cookies when either:
cookie-confirmation.list1: it's been a year since you last saved your settings
cookie-confirmation.list2: we add any new cookies or change the cookies we use
cookie-confirmation.select-continue: Select Continue to go back to the page you were looking at.

dashboard.title: Your Dashboard

apContent.paragraph1: This dashboard allows you to create a new Medical certificate of cause of death (MCCD) and manage current MCCDs.
apContent.paragraph2: This dashboard will list MCCDs that:
apContent.list-item-1: you have submitted to a medical examiner for approval
apContent.list-item-2: have been approved by a medical examiner and need forwarding to the registrar's office
apContent.list-item-3: have been rejected by a medical examiner and need amending
apContent.paragrahp3: Completed MCCDs will be removed after three months.

meContent.paragraph1: This dashboard gives you access to the Medical certificates of cause of death (MCCDs) assigned to you for review and approval.
meContent.paragraph2: An MCCD can only be approved when scrutiny of the proposed cause of death is complete.

meoContent.paragraph1: This dashboard gives you access to the Medical certificates of cause of death (MCCDs) currently being completed in your trust. You can view the progress of MCCDs and download signed-off MCCDs to send to the registrar.

dashboard.noCertificates: There are currently no certificates available for you to view.
dashboard.timeoutWarningText: You will be logged out of the system after 15 minutes of inactivity.

death-less-than-28-days-after-birth.title: Was the death less than 28 days after the birth?
death-less-than-28-days-after-birth.yes-28-days: Yes, the deceased was an infant less than 28 days old
death-less-than-28-days-after-birth.no-28-days: No, the deceased was an adult or child 28 days old or over

ethnicity.label-ethnicity: Select the ethnicity of the deceased person as it is recorded on the patient record. If there is no match with the list, or no ethnicity is recorded on the patient record, select 'not stated'.

mixed-white-group.radio1: English, Welsh, Scottish, Northern Irish or British

mixed-multiple-ethnic-group.radio4: Any other mixed or multiple ethnic background

black-black-british-african-group.radio3: Any other Black, African or Caribbean background

online-service-not-ready.title: You need to complete the paper MCCD for neonatal deaths (Form 65)
online-service-not-ready.description0: You cannot create a medical certificate of cause of death (MCCD) for a person who died during the first 28 days of life yet. This is because the online service is still being developed and not everyone can use it yet.
online-service-not-ready.description1: You can still complete the paper neonatal MCCD (Form 65)
online-service-not-ready.description2: You can get a Form 65 MCCD booklet from:
online-service-not-ready.bulletPoint0: the administration team if you work in a community setting
online-service-not-ready.bulletPoint1: the bereavement team if you work in a trust

tasklist.title: Medical certificate of cause of death (MCCD)

sign-in.pageTitle: Sign in to medical certificate of cause of death
sign-in.title: Sign in
sign-in.sessionLength: Once you have signed in, your session will time out after 60 minutes of inactivity.
sign-in.flash-message: Use your new password to sign in

forgot-password.title: Forgot password
forgot-password.description: We'll email you a code to confirm this is your account.
forgot-password.label: Email address

set-new-password.title: Set a new password
set-new-password.hint2: This is a 6 digit sent to your email address.
set-new-password.details-title: Creating a secure and memorable password
set-new-password.details-text: To create a password that is easy to remember try using three random words. You can use numbers between the words instead of spaces. Avoid words that might be easy to guess or relate to you, such as names of pets.

reset-password.title: Set your password
reset-password.securePassword: Creating a secure and memorable password
reset-password.securePasswordHint: To create a password that is easy to remember try using three random words. You can use numbers between the words instead of spaces. Avoid words that might be easy to guess or relate to you, such as names of pets.

signed-out.title: Signed out
signed-out.text: You have successfully signed out from your account

challenge.title: Sign in
challenge.heading: Enter the code shown by your authentication app
challenge.hint: This is a 6 digit code, like 123 456

timedout.title: Session timed out
timedout.description1: This is because you did not complete the action on the previous page within 3 minutes.
timedout.heading2: For your security, we've signed you out
timedout.description2: Your session ends if you don't use the service for 60 minutes.
timedout.description3: We do this for your security. We have not saved any information you entered.
timedout.3minute: You have 3 minutes to enter these details before your session times out.

form.label-code: Enter the code that appears on your smartphone.
form.hint: This is a 6 digit code, like 123 456

set-up.label-device: Which device do you want to download an authentication app onto?

complete.title: Your account is set up
complete.description: You can use your authentication app to sign in to the Create a medical certificate of cause of death (MCCD) service

error-page.title: Sorry, there is a problem with the service
error-page.heading: Sorry, there is a problem with the service
error-page.content: We have not saved the information you have entered. When the service is available you will need to give us any information you have keyed again.
error-page.content2: if you have an urgent query about the service.

page-not-found.content2: If you pasted the web address, check you copied the entire address.

causeOfDeath2.minLength: Other significant conditions contributing to their death must be 2 characters or more
causeOfDeath2.maxLength: Other significant conditions contributing to their death must be 170 characters or less

onsetInterval2Value.mandatory: Enter time between onset of disease or condition
onsetInterval2Value.invalid: Enter other significant conditions if entering a time between onset and death
onsetInterval2Value.minLength: Time between onset and death must be 2 characters or more
onsetInterval2Value.maxLength: Time between onset and death must be 100 characters or fewer
onsetInterval2Value.badFormat: Time between onset of disease or condition and death must only include digits 0 to 9

onsetInterval2Unit.timeOrUnknown: Enter time between onset of disease or condition or select unknown

isDeathAffectedByJob.mandatory: Select yes if the deceased person's job caused or contributed to their death.

mainCauseOfDeathInInfantA.mandatory: Enter main disease or condition in infant
mainCauseOfDeathInInfantA.minLength: Main disease or condition in infant must be 2 characters or more
mainCauseOfDeathInInfantA.maxLength: Main disease or condition in infant must be 170 characters or less
mainCauseOfDeathInInfantA.badFormat: Main disease or condition in infant must only include letters a to z, digits 0 to 9, full stops, commas, colons, semi-colons, hyphens, apostrophes, ampersands, @ and /

otherDiseasesInInfantB.minLength: Other disease or condition in infant must be 2 characters or more
otherDiseasesInInfantB.maxLength: Other disease or condition in infant must be 170 characters or less
otherDiseasesInInfantB.badFormat: Other disease or condition in infant must only include letters a to z, digits 0 to 9, full stops, commas, colons, semi-colons, hyphens, apostrophes, ampersands, @ and /

maternalConditionsC.minLength: Main maternal disease or condition affecting infant must be 2 characters or more
maternalConditionsC.maxLength: Main maternal disease or condition affecting infant must be 170 characters or less
maternalConditionsC.badFormat: Main maternal disease or condition affecting infant must only include letters a to z, digits 0 to 9, full stops, commas, colons, semi-colons, hyphens, apostrophes, ampersands, @ and /

otherMaternalConditionsD.invalid: Enter Main maternal disease or condition affecting infant.
otherMaternalConditionsD.minLength: Other maternal disease or condition affecting infant must be 2 characters or more
otherMaternalConditionsD.maxLength: Other maternal disease or condition affecting infant must be 170 characters or less
otherMaternalConditionsD.badFormat: Other maternal disease or condition affecting infant must only include letters a to z, digits 0 to 9, full stops, commas, colons, semi-colons, hyphens, apostrophes, ampersands, @ and /

otherRelevantCausesE.minLength: Other relevant factors or circumstances (not diseases of infant or mother) must be 2 characters or more
otherRelevantCausesE.maxLength: Other relevant factors or circumstances (not diseases of infant or mother) must be 170 characters or less
otherRelevantCausesE.badFormat: Other relevant factors or circumstances (not diseases of infant or mother) must only include letters a to z, digits 0 to 9, full stops, commas, colons, semi-colons, hyphens, apostrophes, ampersands, @ and /

firstNames.mandatory: Enter the first name of the deceased person
firstNames.minLength: First name must be 2 characters or more
firstNames.maxLength: First name must be 35 characters or less
firstNames.badFormat: First name must only include letters a to z, and special characters such as hyphens, spaces, apostrophes, accents and diacritics.

lastName.mandatory: Enter the last name of the deceased person
lastName.minLength: Last name must be 2 characters or more
lastName.maxLength: Last name must be 35 characters or less
lastName.badFormat: Last name must only include letters a to z, and special characters such as hyphens, spaces, apostrophes, accents and diacritics.

declaration.mandatory: You must agree to the declaration to send the MCCD

emailAddress.badFormat: Enter an email address in the correct format, like name@example.com

ethnicity.mandatory: Select the ethnicity of the deceased person

meoDeclaration.mandatory: Select that you confirm you have reviewed this certificate and it is ready for scrutiny

meoDownloadDeclaration.mandatory: Select that you have sent this certificate to the registrar

meSignOff.mandatory: Select that this certificate requires amendments or if the certificate is ready to be sent to the registrar

post-mortem.title: Has a post-mortem been held?
post-mortem.radio1: The certified cause of death takes account of information obtained from a post-mortem
post-mortem.radio2: Information from post-mortem may be available later
post-mortem.radio3: A post-mortem is not being held
post-mortem.radio4: This death was reported to the coroner whose duty to investigate under s1 CJA2009 was not engaged

referring-coroner.title: What is the referring senior coroner's name?

referring-practitioner.title: What is the referring medical practitioner's name?

implant.title: Did the deceased person have any implantable medical devices fitted during their lifetime?
implant.details: Enter the details and location of any implants

implantDetails.textLine6: ventricular assist devices (VADs): left ventricular assist devices (LVADs), right ventricular assist devices (RVADs), or biventricular assist devices BiVADs)
implantDetails.textLine7: implantable drug pumps including intrathecal pumps
implantDetails.textLine8: neurostimulators (including for pain and functional electrical stimulation)
implantDetails.textLine12: any other battery powered or pressurised implant

implant-removed.title: Have the implants been removed?
implant-removed.details: Enter the details and location of any implants

additional-information.title: Provide additional information
additional-information.label1: I may be in a position later to give, on application by the Registrar General, additional information as to the cause of death for the purpose of more precise statistical classification.

check-your-answers.title: Check your answers
check-your-answers.additional-information-true: I may be in a position later to give, on application by the Registrar General, additional information as to the cause of death for the purpose of more precise statistical classification.

cause-of-death.caption: Cause of death
cause-of-death.hint: Do not use abbreviations, vague terms, or symptoms.
cause-of-death.title: What caused the death?
cause-of-death.causesOfDeathA: a. Main disease or condition in infant
cause-of-death.causesOfDeathB: b. Other disease or condition in infant (optional)
cause-of-death.causesOfDeathC: c. Main maternal disease or condition affecting infant (optional)
cause-of-death.causesOfDeathD: d. Other maternal diseases or conditions affecting infant (optional)
cause-of-death.causesOfDeathE: e. Other relevant factors or circumstances (not diseases of infant or mother) (optional)

disease-or-condition-leading-to-death.title: What caused the death?
disease-or-condition-leading-to-death.hint: The disease or condition thought to be the underlying cause of death should appear in the lowest completed line of part 1.
disease-or-condition-leading-to-death.causeOfDeath1a: 1(a) Disease or condition directly leading to death
disease-or-condition-leading-to-death.causeOfDeath1b: 1(b) Other disease or condition leading to 1(a) (optional)
disease-or-condition-leading-to-death.causeOfDeath1c: 1(c) Other disease or condition leading to 1(b) (optional)
disease-or-condition-leading-to-death.causeOfDeath1d: 1(d) Other disease or condition leading to 1(c) (optional)
disease-or-condition-leading-to-death.causeOfDeath2: 2 Other significant conditions contributing to the death but not relating to the disease or condition causing it (optional)

job-contributed-to-death.title: Could the deceased person's job have caused or contributed to their death?
job-contributed-to-death.hint: The death might have been due to or contributed to by the employment followed at some time by the deceased.

pregnant-year-before-death.title: Was the deceased pregnant within the year prior to their death?
pregnant-year-before-death.label-pregnant-43-days-1-year: Pregnant 43 days to a year before death

pregnancy-contributed-to-death.title: Did the deceased's pregnancy contribute to their death?

check-your-answers.title: Check your answers
check-your-answers.check-details: Check that all the details are correct before continuing.
check-your-answers.causeOfDeath1a: 1(a) Disease or condition directly leading to death
check-your-answers.causeOfDeath1b: 1(b) Other disease or condition leading to 1(a) (optional)
check-your-answers.causeOfDeath1c: 1(c) Other disease or condition leading to 1(b) (optional)
check-your-answers.causeOfDeath1d: 1(d) Other disease or condition leading to 1(c) (optional)
check-your-answers.mainDiseases: a. Main disease or condition in infant
check-your-answers.otherDiseases: b. Other disease of condition in infant (optional)
check-your-answers.maternalConditions: c. Main maternal disease or condition affecting infant (optional)
check-your-answers.otherMaternalConditions: d. Other maternal diseases or conditions affecting infant (optional)
check-your-answers.additionalConditions: e. Other relevant factors or circumstances (not diseases of infant or mother) (optional)

visually-hidden.cause-death-1a: 1(a) disease or condition directly leading to death
visually-hidden.cause-death-1b: 1(b) Other disease or condition leading to 1(a) (optional)
visually-hidden.cause-death-1c: 1(c) Other disease or condition leading to 1(b) (optional)
visually-hidden.cause-death-1d: 1(d) Other disease or condition leading to 1(c) (optional)

primary-qualification.title: What is your primary qualification?
primary-qualification.hint: As registered by the GMC, for example MB ChB

check-your-details.titleME: Check your details are correct before signing off this certificate
check-your-details.titleAP: Check your details are correct before submitting this certificate for scrutiny

declaration.title: Declaration
declaration.label-me: I am a duly appointed medical examiner and following scrutiny I confirm that the cause of death is as stated in this certificate to the best of my knowledge and belief.
declaration.label-ap: I confirm that I attended the deceased before their death and that the cause of death is as stated in this certificate to the best of my knowledge and belief.

submitted-for-scrutiny.title-panel-text: Medical certificate of cause of death submitted for scrutiny
submitted-for-scrutiny.paragraph-1: This Medical certificate of cause of death (MCCD) will be sent to your medical examiner office for review and scrutiny.
submitted-for-scrutiny.paragraph-2: This certificate will be available to view from your dashboard for 3 months.
submitted-for-scrutiny.what-happens-next-paragraph: You will be contacted by the medical examiner office if, following review and scrutiny of the cause of death the medical examiner requests that you amend this MCCD.

sent-medical-examiners-sign-off.title-panel-text: Certificate sent to medical examiners for sign-off
sent-medical-examiners-sign-off.paragraph-1: Medical examiners in your organisation will now be able to access this certificate from their dashboard. They can review and sign off this certificate as part of the scrutiny process.
sent-medical-examiners-sign-off.what-happens-next-paragraph: When a medical examiner has signed off this certificate you must sign back into the MCCD digital service, download the signed-off certificate, and send it to the registrar.

returned-to-attending-practitioner.title-panel-text: Certificate returned to the attending practitioner
returned-to-attending-practitioner.paragraph-1: You must contact the attending practitioner to inform them that this Medical certificate of cause of death (MCCD) must be amended.
returned-to-attending-practitioner.what-happens-next-paragraph: After the attending practitioner has amended this MCCD it will be available to view on the medical examiner dashboard marked 'For sign off by medical examiner'

mccd-approved.title-panel-text: Medical certificate of cause of death approved
mccd-approved.paragraph-1: You have signed off this Medical certificate of cause of death (MCCD) following scrutiny of the cause of death.
mccd-approved.what-happens-next-paragraph: This MCCD will be sent to the local register office by your medical examiner office. There is nothing further for you to do.

sent-to-local-register-office.title-panel-text: Certificate downloaded and sent to the local register office
sent-to-local-register-office.what-happens-next-paragraph-2: This Medical certificate of cause of death (MCCD) will be available to view from your dashboard for three months.

mccd-amended.title-panel-text: Medical certificate of cause of death amended
mccd-amended.what-happens-next-paragraph-2: This Medical certificate of cause of death (MCCD) will be available to view from your dashboard for three months.

confirmation.survey-link: Tell us what you think about the Complete an MCCD service (takes about 5 minutes)

maintenance.heading: Scheduled Maintenance
maintenance.text1: This site will be down for essential maintenance on

viewMccdContent.title-header: Medical certificate of cause of death (MCCD)
viewMccdContent.amend-inset-text: This MCCD must be amended. Contact your medical examiner officer to find out what amendments you must make.
viewMccdContent.submitted-inset1: This MCCD has been  signed off by a medical examiner and sent to the local register office.
viewMccdContent.submitted-inset2: There is nothing further for you to do.
viewMccdContent.send-to-registrar-inset1: This MCCD has been reviewed and signed off by a medical examiner. The medical examiner office will forward this certificate to the local register office.

meoDeclaration.heading: Medical examiner officer review
meoDeclaration.label: I certify, to the best of my knowledge, that this certificate can be signed off by a medical examiner

meoDownloadDeclaration.heading: Download certificate
meoDownloadDeclaration.paragraph: Download this certificate to your computer and send it to the registrar as an email attachment. After you have sent this MCCD to the registrar return to this screen and mark it as sent by ticking the checkbox.
meoDownloadDeclaration.label: I have sent this certificate to the registrar.
